Package model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
model.Board
public class Board extends Object
This is the main driver of the sudoku game it will create the board out of cell object and set thier value to 0 to mark that they are not filled this also hold the main logic of filling a space in the baord and check the board is not breaking the rules of sudoku and it will check if a game is compleated Authors: Bryan Bielawa, Carissa Burnham, Cooper Harris, Drew Marien

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> boardValues)
      this can take in a premade board and create one for testing perpuposes
      Parameters:
      boardValues - the cell values

    • Board

      public Board(int size, int difficulty)
      This will likely be used by the sudoku program as it can generate a random board for playing. The difficulty setting scales the difficulty: 1 = hard ~= 11% of board filled 2 = medium ~= 22% of board filled 3 = easy ~= 33% of board filled
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the board it could be 4, 6, or 9
      difficulty - it can be easy medium or hard

    • Board

      public Board(int size)
      This is also for testing, it will generate an empty board of a given size. Every value will be zero in accordance to our empty cell standard. sets difficulty to zero.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the board it could be 9, 6, or 4

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(int row, int col)
      this will get a cell from the board by using the boardCell to get it row and colum and return it as an cell classs to the caller
      Parameters:
      row - the row at which a item in the board is found
      col - the colum at which a item in the board is found
      Returns:
      a cell object from specified coord

    • getCellInt

      public int getCellInt(int row, int col)
      this will get a cell from the board by using the boardCell to get it row and colum and return it as an integer value to the caller
      Parameters:
      row - the row at which a item in the board is found
      col - the colum at which a item in the board is found
      Returns:
      the value of the specified cell

    • togglePencilmark

      public void togglePencilmark(int row, int col)
      This will set toggle the pencilmark/pencilmark value of a cell. If it is a pencil mark if will become a regular value. If it isn't a pencil mark it will become one.
      Parameters:
      row - the row at which a item in the board is found
      col - the colum at which a item in the board is found

    • isCellPencilmark

      public boolean isCellPencilmark(int row, int col)
      This will return true if a specified cell is a pencilmark
      Parameters:
      row - the row at which a item in the board is found
      col - the colum at which a item in the board is found

    • generateBoardValueArray

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> generateBoardValueArray(int width, int spread)
      * making this public to help with testing the spread parameter is the max number of values that can be generated per every 3x3
      Parameters:
      width - is the size of the board.
      spread - how much of the board is filled
      Returns:
      the final board

    • isBoardComplete

      public boolean isBoardComplete()
      this will return true if the board obeys all the rules of sudoku There is additional functionality with the parameter. If it is set to true, then it will behave as if the board is currently full and return true if every number on the board is valid within the rules. If it is false, it will anticipate finding pencilmarks and empty cells. The purpose is of the false value is to verify if a randomly generated board is playable.
      Returns:
      return true if boad is solved

    • getBoard

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Cell>> getBoard()
      this will return the current board
      Returns:
      the current board

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      this will get the current size of the board
      Returns:
      size the size of the board

    • updateBoardVal

      public void updateBoardVal(int row, int col, int newVal)
      this will update the value of a cell in the board so that the game can be played it will get the cell form the board and set it to a new value denoted by the user
      Parameters:
      row - the row at which the cell to be updated resides
      col - the colum at which the cell to be updated resides
      newVal - the value the cell will be changed to

    • findErrorsInBoard

      public ArrayList<Integer> findErrorsInBoard()
      this will find the cordinates of all errors that can be found in the given board if they exist and add them to an array that way it can be marked on the gui where errors from the user accured
      Returns:
      ArrayList this stores all the coords where a error accured and return it to the user
